title: Is there a term to describe the dot in a lowercase "i" ?
content:
Does anybody know what the term for the dot in a lowercase “i” is?

 [‹ Ponderings from a Greenhorn...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410204847/http:/typophile.com/node/19136 "Go to previous forum topic") [Dirk Wachowiak? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410204847/http:/typophile.com/node/19182 "Go to next forum topic")
author: modernangel76

comments.content:
I think it’s just “dot”, quite distinct from “period”(.)  
The “dot accent” used in some languages (eg Polish over z) is the exact same dot.
That answer’s a bit too titillating sii

i thought tittle was the cross on the t and jot the dot on the i.

—-

edit  
seems sii was right! [tittle](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410204847/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tittle)

According to Adam Twardoch’s [diacritics howto](http://web.archive.org/web/20080410204847/http:/www.twardoch.com/download/polishhowto/kropka.html), I think it should be called “kropka”. I know that’s technically the name of the polish diacritic, but typographically it’s exactly the same as the dot on the i, so why not?

semper ex typophile aliquod novi, sorry to mix languages.  
Tim

Although what Paul says sounds familiar, looks like OED agrees with Si (see 1b):

**tittle, _n._**  
**1.** A small stroke or point in writing or printing. **a.** Orig. rendering L. _apex_ ‘point, tip’, applied in classical L. to any minute point or part of a letter, also to the mark over a long vowel, as _á_, later also to a line indicating an abbreviation. More recently applied also to the Spanish _tilde_ or circumflex over _ñ_, formerly to the cedilla under _ç_. By extension, any stroke or tick with a pen.  
**b.** The dot over the letter _i_; a punctuation mark; a diacritic point over a letter; any one of the Hebrew and Arabic vowel-points and accents; also, a pip on dice.  
**†c.** A name for the (usually) three dots, following the letters and contractions, in the alphabet on horn-books, where it is usually followed by _Est Amen_; so that **_tittle est Amen_** came to be used for ‘the end or conclusion’. _Obs._
